intro: Homoranthus virgatus, commonly known as the slender sand-verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has slender, erect stems and small, opposite leaves. Homoranthus virgatus is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing nectar for pollinators.
